user_manual.title: User Manual
user_manual.description: How to use tools or assets for example the user manual for the gdscript fromatter.

study_guide.title: Study Guide
study_guide.description: All written learning resources that are not step-by-step tutorials or cheatsheets

cheatsheet.title: Cheatsheet
cheatsheet.description: Quick reference sheets covering different features and concepts in Godot with key information that's quick to scan and reference.

tutorial.title: Tutorial
tutorial.description: learning resource written in a step-by-step format to achieve something. If the tutorial is in video format, "video" takes precedence as the format

downloadable.title: Downloadable
downloadable.description: Includes standalone (without guides): tools, demos, assets, files, scripts

demo.title: Demo, Code Template
demo.description: Demos or code templates that you can use to learn or build upon

general.title: General
general.description: Resources that are not tied to a specific tool or tool version

krita.title: Krita
krita.description: Resources that apply to any version of Krita.

character_progression.title: Character Progression
character_progression.description: Character progression refers to systems that allow game characters to grow stronger over time through gaining experience points, leveling up, and improving their stats or abilities. This is a core mechanic in RPG games that rewards players for playing and creates a sense of advancement.

input_remapping.title: Input Remapping
input_remapping.description: Input remapping allows players to change keyboard keys, mouse buttons, or controller inputs assigned to game actions. This feature lets players customize controls to match their preferences or accessibility needs, making games more comfortable and inclusive to play.

user_interface.title: User Interface
user_interface.description: User Interface (UI) refers to the visual elements players interact with in a game, such as menus, buttons, health bars, and score displays. UI helps players navigate the game and see important information on screen.

pause.title: Pause System
pause.description: A pause system temporarily stops gameplay while keeping the game running, usually triggered by the player pressing a button. It allows players to take a break, access settings, or return to the main menu without losing progress.

art_graphics.title: Art/Graphics
art_graphics.description: Resources related to art and graphics for game development.

3d_model.title: 3D Model
3d_model.description: 3d models of characters, objects, and scenes.

vfx.title: VFX
vfx.description: Everything related to visual effects including particle systems, post-processing effects, and more.

level_design.title: Level Design
level_design.description: Level design is the process of creating game environments, layouts, and challenges where players interact and progress. It involves placing objects, enemies, platforms, and other elements to create engaging gameplay experiences.

steering_behaviors.title: Steering Behavior
steering_behaviors.description: Steering behaviors are AI movement patterns that make game characters move naturally and autonomously, like following a leader, avoiding obstacles, or pursuing targets. These behaviors use vector math to calculate smooth, realistic movement for AI agents.

game_systems.title: Game System
game_systems.description: Game systems are the underlying rules and mechanics that control how a game works, such as combat, inventory, progression, or resource management. They define the interactive elements that make up the gameplay experience.

multiplayer.title: Multiplayer
multiplayer.description: Multiplayer refers to game features that allow multiple players to interact and play together, either locally or online. This includes networking, matchmaking, synchronization, and real-time communication between players.

csharp.title: C#
csharp.description: C# is a programming language that can be used in game engines like Godot and Unity to write game scripts and logic. It is a popular alternative to languages like GDScript or Python for creating game behavior and systems.

character_controller.title: Character Controller
character_controller.description: Character controllers are scripts that handle the movement of a player character in a game.

game_design.title: Game Design
game_design.description: Game design is the process of creating the rules, mechanics, systems, and goals that make a game fun and playable. It focuses on how a game works and feels to play, separate from programming or art implementation.

crafting.title: Crafting System
crafting.description: A crafting system allows players to combine resources or ingredients from their inventory to create new items. This mechanic is commonly used in survival games, RPGs, and simulation games where resource gathering and item creation are core gameplay elements.

best_practices.title: Best Practices
best_practices.description: Guidelines, good practices and methods, or recommendations to be effective in gamedev.

procedural_generation.title: Procedural Generation
procedural_generation.description: Procedural generation is a technique that creates game content automatically using algorithms and mathematical rules instead of designing everything by hand. It is commonly used to generate terrain, levels, textures, and other game elements that feel natural and varied.

inventory.title: Inventory
inventory.description: An inventory is a system in games that stores and manages items that players collect, use, or trade. It typically includes features like adding items, removing items, displaying item information, and organizing storage space.

audio.title: Audio
audio.description: Audio refers to all sound elements in games, including music, sound effects, voice acting, and ambient sounds. It encompasses the technical and creative aspects of implementing and designing audio to enhance player experience and game atmosphere.

rendering.title: Rendering
rendering.description: Rendering is the process of generating visual output by drawing graphics to the screen in a game engine. It includes managing draw calls, GPU operations, and optimization techniques to display 2D and 3D content efficiently.

networking.title: Networking
networking.description: Networking in game development refers to the systems and code that enable multiple players to connect and interact in real-time or turn-based games. It includes client-server communication, data synchronization, matchmaking, and handling network events across different devices.

engine_updates.title: Engine Update
engine_updates.description: Information about new versions and improvements made to game engines. Engine updates typically include performance improvements, new features, bug fixes, and optimizations that developers can use in their projects.

character_skin.title: Character Skin
character_skin.description: Rigged 3D characters with animations and textures.

quest.title: Quest
quest.description: A quest system is a game feature that manages missions or tasks players complete for rewards. It tracks objectives, progress, and handles quest states from available to completed.

music.title: Music
music.description: Music in game development refers to the background music, themes, and musical compositions that create atmosphere and enhance the player's emotional experience. This includes composing, producing, and implementing audio tracks using various music production tools and techniques.

animation.title: Animation
animation.description: Resources related to animation techniques and tools for game development.

workflow.title: Workflow
workflow.description: Workflows that outline procedures or steps to accomplish tasks.

camera.title: Camera
camera.description: A camera is the viewport through which players see your game world. It controls what portion of the game scene is visible on screen and how it is displayed (perspective, zoom, angle).

physics.title: Physics
physics.description: Everything related to game physics including collision detection, rigid bodies, physics processing, and more.

split_screen.title: Split Screen
split_screen.description: Techniques and tricks for displaying different views of the game on the same screen

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Resources about communicating well with the community, your audience, or team members.

shaders.title: Shader
shaders.description: Shaders are programs that run on the GPU to control how graphics are rendered, including colors, textures, and visual effects. They allow developers to create custom visual styles and effects by manipulating vertices (vertex shaders) or pixels (fragment shaders).

full_game.title: Full Game
full_game.description: Complete games that are playable from start to finish.

gdscript.title: GDScript
gdscript.description: GDScript is Godot Engine's high-level, gradually typed programming language designed for game development. It's optimized for Godot and integrates tightly with the engine.

ai.title: AI
ai.description: AI (Artificial Intelligence) in game development refers to systems that control non-player characters and create intelligent behaviors like movement, decision-making, and reactions. AI makes game characters appear to think and act independently.

combat_systems.title: Combat System
combat_systems.description: Resources related to combat systems in game development.

performance_optimization.title: Performance Optimization
performance_optimization.description: Performance optimization refers to techniques and practices used to make games run faster and more smoothly by reducing resource usage and improving efficiency. This includes methods to handle more objects on screen, reduce lag, maintain stable frame rates, and ensure games work well on different hardware.

editor_plugins.title: Editor Plugin
editor_plugins.description: Editor plugins are custom tools that extend the game engine's editor interface to add new functionality, custom inspectors, or interactive viewport tools. They allow developers to create specialized workflows and automate tasks within the editor environment.

learning_resource.title: Learning Resource
learning_resource.description: Learning resources that provide information, instructions, or guidance for learning a topic or skill.

tool.title: Tool
tool.description: Tools and utilities for various tasks and workflows.

shader.title: Shader
shader.description: Shaders are programs that run on the GPU to render graphics.

asset.title: Asset or Model
asset.description: 3D or 2D assets or models for use in game development.

mit.title: MIT
mit.description: The MIT License is a permissive free software license originating at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. As a permissive license, it puts only very limited restriction on reuse and has, therefore, high license compatibility.

ccby.title: CC BY-SA
ccby.description: The CC BY-SA license is a Creative Commons license that requires attribution and that any derivative works be distributed under the same license.

2d_3d.title: 2D/3D
2d_3d.description: Assets, scenes, learning resources, and projects that can be used in both 2D and 3D games, or that cover concepts relevant to both dimensions.

any.title: Any game space
any.description: Assets, scenes, learning resources, and projects where the concept of "game space" is inapplicable

any.title: Any Genre
any.description: Game development topics that apply to all game genres, like common engine features, game development techniques, or programming concepts.

survivor.title: Survivor
survivor.description: Games that are inspired by Vampire Survivors.

roguelite.title: RogueLite
roguelite.description: Games that are inspired by the roguelike genre.

kinematic_jump_formulas.title: Kinematic Jump Formulas for 2D and 3D Games
kinematic_jump_formulas.label: Kinematic Jump Formulas
kinematic_jump_formulas.description: Get ready-to-use formulas to calculate jump physics based on height, timing, and distance instead of guessing the jump speed and gravity values. You can reuse these simple formulas to precisely control jumps in any 2D or 3D game.
